config.taskName: Area-owners
config.replyTemplate:
Tagging subscribers to this area: ${mentionees}
See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.

parameters.comment:
Added `needs-breaking-change-doc-created` label because this issue has the `breaking-change` label. 

1. [ ] Create and link to this issue a matching issue in the dotnet/docs repo using the [breaking change documentation template](https://github.com/dotnet/docs/issues/new?assignees=gewarren&labels=breaking-change%2CPri1%2Cdoc-idea&template=breaking-change.yml&title=%5BBreaking+change%5D%3A+), then remove this `needs-breaking-change-doc-created` label.

Tagging @dotnet/compat for awareness of the breaking change.

config.taskName: Add breaking change doc label to issue

parameters.comment:
Added `needs-breaking-change-doc-created` label because this PR has the `breaking-change` label. 

When you commit this breaking change:

1. [ ] Create and link to this PR and the issue a matching issue in the dotnet/docs repo using the [breaking change documentation template](https://github.com/dotnet/docs/issues/new?assignees=gewarren&labels=breaking-change%2CPri1%2Cdoc-idea&template=breaking-change.yml&title=%5BBreaking+change%5D%3A+), then remove this `needs-breaking-change-doc-created` label.
2. [ ] Ask a committer to mail the `.NET Breaking Change Notification` DL.

Tagging @dotnet/compat for awareness of the breaking change.

config.taskName: Manual Issue Cleanup

parameters.comment:
Due to lack of recent activity, this issue has been marked as a candidate for backlog cleanup.  It will be closed if no further activity occurs within 14 more days. Any new comment (by anyone, not necessarily the author) will undo this process.

This process is part of our [issue cleanup automation](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/issue-cleanup.md).

config.taskName: Automated Issue cleanup

parameters.comment:
Due to lack of recent activity, this issue has been marked as a candidate for backlog cleanup.  It will be closed if no further activity occurs within 14 more days. Any new comment (by anyone, not necessarily the author) will undo this process.

This process is part of our [issue cleanup automation](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/issue-cleanup.md).

config.taskName: Add untriaged label to new/reopened issues without a milestone
Remove untriaged label from issues when closed or added to a milestone
Add `in-pr` label on issue when an open pull request is targeting it
config.inPrLabelText: There is an active PR which will close this issue when it is merged

config.taskName: Assign Team PRs to author
Label community PRs
Needs-author-action notification

parameters.comment: This issue has been marked `needs-author-action` and may be missing some important information.

config.taskName: PR reviews with "changes requested" applies the needs-author-action label
Replace `needs-author-action` label with `needs-further-triage` label when the author comments on an issue
Pushing changes to PR branch removes the needs-author-action label
Author commenting in PR removes the needs-author-action label
Author responding to a pull request review comment removes the needs-author-action label
Add no-recent-activity label to issues

parameters.comment: This issue has been automatically marked `no-recent-activity` because it has not had any activity for 14 days. It will be closed if no further activity occurs within 14 more days. Any new comment (by anyone, not necessarily the author) will remove `no-recent-activity`.

config.taskName: Add no-recent-activity label to PRs

parameters.comment: This pull request has been automatically marked `no-recent-activity` because it has not had any activity for 14 days. It will be closed if no further activity occurs within 14 more days. Any new comment (by anyone, not necessarily the author) will remove `no-recent-activity`.

config.taskName: Remove `no-recent-activity` label from issues when issue is modified
Remove `no-recent-activity` label when an issue is commented on
Remove `no-recent-activity` label from PRs when modified
Remove `no-recent-activity` label from PRs when commented on
Remove `no-recent-activity` label from PRs when new review is added
Close issues with no recent activity

parameters.comment: This issue will now be closed since it had been marked `no-recent-activity` but received no further activity in the past 14 days. It is still possible to reopen or comment on the issue, but please note that the issue will be locked if it remains inactive for another 30 days.

config.taskName: Close PRs with no-recent-activity

parameters.comment: This pull request will now be closed since it had been marked `no-recent-activity` but received no further activity in the past 14 days. It is still possible to reopen or comment on the pull request, but please note that it will be locked if it remains inactive for another 30 days.

config.taskName: Close inactive Draft PRs

parameters.comment: Draft Pull Request was automatically closed for 30 days of inactivity. Please [let us know](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you'd like to reopen it.
